feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued January 07 at 4:20PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Rain and Snow Moving Into the Area... A strong front moving north through Cook Inlet this afternoon will bring light rain and snow showers along with gusty winds this afternoon. As the front approaches a transition to heavy snow is expected around 6 PM AKST. Expect low visibilities in heavy snow bands from around 6 PM AKST to around 9 PM AKST this evening.

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 07 at 12:37PM AKST until January 08 at 6:00AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WIDESPREAD SNOW FOR THE PANHANDLE... .A decaying frontal band is expected to move over the area Sunday evening and diminish Monday morning. Weaker winds aloft will limit the mixing of warm air down to the surface leading to most areas staying as snow. While overall moisture remains low, there is a possibly of higher amounts around the Icy Strait

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued January 07 at 11:29AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Elevated Water Levels At Hooper Bay through Monday... Elevated Water levels of 2 to 3 feet above the normal high tide line are possible through Sunday, with 1 to 2 feet Monday as winds switch to southwesterly and weaken. Residents should be aware of the possibility of minor flooding along the shore with ice piling up along the beach.
